benchmark_details.name: MATTER-OF-FACT
benchmark_details.overview: MATTER-OF-FACT is a challenge dataset for determining the feasibility of hypotheses framed as claims, operationalizing feasibility assessment as a temporally-filtered claim verification task using backtesting.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark to assist in improving model performance over time in the feasibility assessment of scientific claims.

data.source: Claims extracted from recent materials science articles, primarily sourced from Arxiv.
data.annotation: Claims generated through a combination of human curation and automated systems.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated by comparing model predictions against gold labels assigned by experts.
methodology.interpretation: Performance is interpreted based on the percentage of correct predictions compared to total predictions.
methodology.baseline_results: Strong baselines achieve a maximum of 72% accuracy.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated through domain expert evaluation.
